title: feat: add HTTP Basic Auth to KPI dashboard
author: ElliotEtag

gist.headline: The hive gets a bouncer
gist.blurb: Added a password lock to our internal KPI dashboard. Keeping the honey safe from accidental clicks.
gist.summary: Implemented optional HTTP Basic Auth middleware for the KPI dashboard worker, allowing password protection via Wrangler secrets.
gist.impact: Internal operational metrics can now be secured while maintaining backward compatibility for public access.
gist.visual_concept: A pixel art gate or door with a lock, guarding a garden of charts/graphs. The bee is the gatekeeper.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the bee mascot wearing a tiny security guard hat, hovering next to a locked gate that leads to a garden of glowing charts. A robot companion checks a clipboard. Cozy 8-bit pixel art aesthetic. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel peach gradient background. The bee and robot have chunky retro sprites. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Pixel text: 'ACCESS GRANTED'. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
